text: Michael Jones (July 5, 1865 – March 24, 1894) was a Major League Baseball pitcher. He made three starts for the American Association champion Louisville Colonels in , earning the win in two of them. He also had four hits and two walks in his eleven career plate appearances. ==Sources== Category:1865 births Category:1894 deaths Category:19th-century baseball players Category:Baseball people from Ontario Category:Canadian expatriate baseball players in the United States Category:Major League Baseball pitchers Category:Louisville Colonels players Category:Guelph Maple Leafs players Category:Hamilton Primrose players Category:Hamilton Clippers players Category:Hamilton Hams players Category:London Tecumsehs (baseball) players Category:Major League Baseball players from Canada Category:Sportspeople from Hamilton, Ontario
title: Mike Jones (1890s pitcher)
